title: Print simplified, clutter-free pages in Firefox
summary: Firefox lets you print pages in a simplified format that strips away clutter like buttons, ads, and background images. Learn more.
html:
Firefox lets you print pages in a simplified format that strips away clutter like buttons, ads, and background images, for better readability and paper/ink savings.

  • For more information on printing in Firefox, see How to print web pages in Firefox.

Use one of these methods to print clutter-free pages in Firefox:

Select Simplified format in print settings

  1. Click on the menu button and then click Print…. A print preview and print settings will be displayed.
  2. Click on More settings in the right panel to see additional print settings.
  3. Go down to Format settings and select Simplified. The print preview will change to a simplified version.
  4. Click Print.
Note: Format settings will be missing if a simplified version of the page is unavailable or if you have turned on Reader View for the page before printing.

Turn on Reader View before printing

To get a print-friendly view, turn on Reader View for the page before printing:

  1. If a page is available in Reader View, the Reader View icon will appear in the address bar.
  2. Click on the Reader View icon . The icon will turn blue when the page is in Reader View.
  3. Click the menu button to open the menu panel.
  4. Click Print to preview the page and print it.
